result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick Lee Lomker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply bond on file to DNA surcharge.
Court suspends costs.
Defendant to report to the jail for a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erick Lee Lomker

CO: Lundell, RPR: Sharesa Desotelle, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Erick Lee Lomker appeared.  Court called at 2:02 p.m.   There is an agreement.  State amends Ct. 1 to 947.01 (State Disorderly Conduct) DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1 State Disorderly Conduct.  Crt reviews the police reports and the attorneys stipulate to the facts.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1  947.01 (State Disorderly Conduct. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- DE sentenced to 4 days in the St. Croix County Jail 
- DE credited for 4 days served
- Court suspends costs
- DE to pay $200 for a DNA surcharge/apply money on file
- Court will hold the $50.00 refund until the DE contacts the Clerk of Court Office with his updated address.
- DE to report to the jail for a DNA sample
- 20 days to appeal
Plea hearing on April 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
for Suppression of Illegal Search and Seizure. Filed by Atty Andrea. hml
Motion hearing on May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Erick Lee Lomker appeared.  Court called at 9:08 a.m.  Set for Motion Hearing filed by Attorney .  ADA Nieskes argues Attorney Andrea not filing a proper Motion for todays hearing.  Attorneys argue the Motion.  Court requests Attorney Andrea to file a new Motion that is more detailed.  Continue the Motion Hearing.  Verified the DEs address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 9:14 a.m. lw  Motion hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Verified DE's address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:11 p.m. lw  Motion hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Def is on PO Hold. Agent Anderson requests that 30 Days Jail stay be lifted. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Bond remains the same. km

Pre-trial conference at 03-07-2016 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Erick Lee Lomker appeared from jail. Court confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. ADA Nieskes is requesting $250.00 CB. Defendant is on a PO hold.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
